00056 CELTransformerEngine * CELTransformerEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00057 {
00058         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == CELTransformerEngine::EngineName())
00059                 return (CELTransformerEngine *)engine;
00060         return NULL;
00061 }

00071 
00072 void CELTransformerEngine::defineOptions()
00073 {
00074         setUsage("apt-cel-transformer - Utility program for taking cel files and converting them\n"
00075                 "using a ChipStream path and saving the results to a modified set of cel files.\n"
00076                 "An example would include rma background subtracting and normalizing a set\n"
00077                 "of cel files that could then be used in another application without those\n"
00078                 "capabilities.\n"
00079                 "\n"
00080                 " *Warning* - If the output directory is the same as the input directory the\n"
00081                 "the original cel files will be overwritten with the transformed ones.\n"
00082                 "\n"
00083                 "A chipstream pathway is specified by a comma separated list of transformations\n"
00084                 "with specific parameters passed as key value pairs. For example:\n"
00085                 "rma-bg,quant-norm.usepm=true.sketch=50000 -> rma background subtract and then\n"
00086                 "                                             quantile normalize using only PM\n"
00087                 "                                             probes and a sketch size of 50K\n"
00088                 "rma-bg,med-norm -> rma background subtraction and then median normalization.\n"
00089                 "\n"
00090                 "usage:\n"
00091                 "   apt-cel-transformer -d chip.cdf -c rma-bg,quant-norm.sketch=50000 -o out-dir \\ \n"
00092                 "      celFile1.cel celFile2.cel ... celFileN.cel\n");
00093 
00094 
00095         defineOption("", "target-sketch", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00096                 "File specifying a target distribution to use for quantile normalization.",
00097                 "");
00098         defineOption("", "a5-target-sketch", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00099                 "File specifying an target distribution to use for quantile normalization in A5 format.",
00100                 "");
00101         defineOption("c", "chipstream", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00102                 "String representing tranformation desired. "
00103                 "For example: 'quant-norm.sketch=50000' does a quantile normalization using 50000 points.",
00104                 "");
00105         defineOption("", "probe-norm-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00106                 "File specifying index of probes (1 based) to use for normalization.",
00107                 "");
00108         defineOption("", "use-disk", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00109                 "Store CEL intensities to be analyzed on disk.", "true");
00110         defineOption("", "disk-cache", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00111                 "Size of intensity memory cache in millions of intensities (when --use-disk=true).",
00112                 "50");
00113 
00114         defineOption("", "cel-files", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00115                 "Text file specifying cel files to process, one per line with the first line being 'cel_files'.",
00116                 "");
00117         defOptMult("", "cels", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00118         "Cel files to process.",
00119         "");
00120         defineOption("d", "cdf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00121                 "File defining probe sets",
00122                 "");
00123         defineOption("", "clf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00124                 "File defining probes",
00125                 "");
00126         defineOption("", "kill-list", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00127                 "File defining probes to remove",
00128                 "");
00129         defineOption("", "pgf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00130                 "File defining probe sets",
00131                 "");
00132         defineOption("", "spf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00133                 "File defining probe sets",
00134                 "");
00135         defineOption("", "write-sketch", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00136                 "Write the quantile normalization distribution (or sketch) "
00137                 "to a file in output-dir for reuse with target-sketch option.",
00138                 "false");
00139         defineOption("", "a5-write-sketch", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00140                 "Write the quantile normalization distribution (or sketch) "
00141                 "to a file in output-dir for reuse with target-sketch option.",
00142                 "false");
00143         defineOption("", "update-header", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT, 
00144                 "Change guid and add apt-cel-transform meta info.", "true");
00145         defineOption("","qc-probesets", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00146                 "File defining qc probe sets",
00147                 "");
00148 }
00149 
00150 /** 
00151 * Figure out chip dimensions from the cel file specified.
00152 * 
00153 * @param fileName - Name of cel file to read header from.
00154 * @param numCols - Number of x columns.
00155 * @param numRows - Number of y rows.
00156 */
00157 static void getDimensions(string fileName, colrow_t& numCols, colrow_t& numRows) {
00158         FusionCELData cel;
00159         cel.SetFileName(fileName.c_str());
00160         if (!cel.ReadHeader()) 
00161                 Err::errAbort("Can't read cel file: " + cel.GetFileName());
00162         numCols = cel.GetCols();
00163         numRows = cel.GetRows();
00164         cel.Close();
00165 }
00166 
00167 /**
00168 * Transform AGCC CEL Files
00169 */
00170 void CELTransformerEngine::transformNew(int celIx, vector<ChipStream *> &cStreamVec) {
00171 
00172         string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00173         string outCelFileName = Fs::join(outDir , Fs::basename(celFiles[celIx]));
00174         vector<string> tmpFileNames;
00175         GlobalTmpFileFactory()->setTmpdir(outDir);
00176 
00177         try {
00178                 // read agcc cel file
00179                 affymetrix_calvin_io::CelFileReader reader;
00180                 reader.SetFilename(celFiles[celIx]);
00181                 affymetrix_calvin_io::CelFileData cel;
00182                 reader.Read(cel);
00183                 int numCells;
00184                 WStringVector channelVec = cel.GetChannels();
00185                 for (int channelIx = 0; channelIx < channelVec.size(); ++channelIx) {
00186                         cel.SetActiveChannel(channelVec[channelIx]);
00187                         numCells = cel.GetNumCells();
00188                         vector<float> intensities;
00189                         if (!cel.GetIntensities(0,numCells,intensities))
00190                                 Err::errAbort("Unable to retrieve intensities for " + celFiles[celIx]);
00191                         vector<float> stdev;
00192                         if (!cel.GetStdev(0,numCells,stdev))
00193                                 Err::errAbort("Unable to retrieve stdev for " + celFiles[celIx]);
00194                         vector<int16_t>  npixels;
00195                         if (!cel.GetNumPixels(0,numCells,npixels))
00196                                 Err::errAbort("Unable to retrieve num pixels for " + celFiles[celIx]);
00197                         vector<XYCoord> outliers;
00198                         cel.GetOutlierCoords(outliers);
00199 
00200                         vector<XYCoord> masked;
00201                         cel.GetMaskedCoords(masked);
00202 
00203                         string workingCelFileName = outCelFileName;
00204                         // if multi-channel Cel, then temp single-channel Cels have to be
00205                         // written and then collated later
00206                         if (channelVec.size() > 1) {
00207                                 // make temporary output CEL file
00208                                 workingCelFileName = GlobalTmpFileFactory()->genFilename(StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(channelVec[channelIx]) + ".", ".cel");
00209                                 tmpFileNames.push_back(workingCelFileName);
00210                         }
00211 
00212                         affymetrix_calvin_io::CelFileData outCel(workingCelFileName);
00213 
00214                         affymetrix_calvin_io::GenericDataHeader *inHdr = cel.GetFileHeader()->GetGenericDataHdr();
00215                         affymetrix_calvin_io::GenericDataHeader *outHdr = outCel.GetFileHeader()->GetGenericDataHdr();
00216                         ParameterNameValueType param;
00217                         int headerCount = inHdr->GetNameValParamCnt();
00218                         for (int hdrIx = 0; hdrIx < headerCount; ++hdrIx) {
00219                                 param = inHdr->GetNameValParam(hdrIx);
00220                                 outHdr->AddNameValParam(param);
00221                         }
00222                         affymetrix_calvin_io::GenDataHdrVectorIt begin, end;
00223                         inHdr->GetParentIterators(begin, end);
00224                         while (begin != end) {
00225                                 // this snippet of commented code was useful for generating
00226                                 // test data.  it writes the temporary single-channel CELs as
00227                                 // proper CEL files that do not require the CelReader HACK.
00228                                 // (hard-coded adjustment of the number of channels in a
00229                                 // single-channel CEL that was derived from a multi-channel
00230                                 // CEL).  as the code stands, if this snippet were uncommented
00231                                 // this tool would break.  the code is left here for now as a
00232                                 // reference to how I made the test data.
00233                                 //                 if (begin->FindNameValParam(AFFY_WAVELENGTH, param)) {
00234                                 //                     param.SetValueText(channelVec[channelIx]);
00235                                 //                     begin->AddNameValParam(param);
00236                                 //                 }
00237                                 outHdr->AddParent(*begin);
00238                                 begin++;
00239                         }    
00240 
00241                         // add wavelength info if this is multichannel -- the
00242                         // collator uses this field to name the data groups
00243                         if (channelVec.size() > 1) {
00244                                 param.SetName(AFFY_FILTER_WAVELENGTH);
00245                                 param.SetValueText(channelVec[channelIx]);
00246                                 outHdr->AddNameValParam(param);
00247                         }
00248 
00249                         if (getOptBool("update-header") == true) {
00250                                 // change guid and store old one in header
00251                                 affymetrix_calvin_utilities::AffymetrixGuidType oldGuid = inHdr->GetFileId();
00252                                 param.SetName(L"affymetrix-previous-guid");
00253                                 param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(oldGuid));
00254                                 outHdr->AddNameValParam(param);
00255                                 // store command-line in new CEL header
00256                                 param.SetName(L"affymetrix-algorithm-param-command-line");
00257                                 param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(commandLine()));
00258                                 outHdr->AddNameValParam(param);
00259 
00260                                 std::string s_chipstream = getOpt("chipstream");
00261 
00262                                 if (strstr (s_chipstream.c_str (),"gc-correction"))
00263                                 {
00264                                         param.SetName(L"affymetrix-algorithm-param-gc-correction");
00265                                         param.SetValueText(L"true");
00266                                         outHdr->AddNameValParam(param);
00267                                 }
00268 
00269                                 if (strstr (s_chipstream.c_str (),"scale-intensities"))
00270                                 {
00271                                         param.SetName(L"affymetrix-algorithm-param-SST");
00272                                         param.SetValueText(L"true");
00273                                         outHdr->AddNameValParam(param);
00274                                 }
00275                         }
00276 
00277                         outCel.SetIntensityCount(intensities.size());
00278                         outCel.SetStdDevCount(stdev.size());
00279                         outCel.SetPixelCount(npixels.size());
00280                         outCel.SetOutlierCount(outliers.size());
00281                         outCel.SetMaskCount(masked.size());
00282 
00283                         //  writer
00284                         affymetrix_calvin_io::CelFileWriter writer(outCel);
00285                         // get and transform intensities.
00286                         for (int featIx = 0; featIx < numCells; featIx++) {
00287                                 intensities[featIx] = (*cStreamVec[cStreamVec.size() - 1]).getTransformedIntensity(featIx, celIx, channelIx);
00288                         }
00289 
00290                         // write out new intensity values
00291                         writer.WriteIntensities(intensities);
00292 
00293                         // copy over other parts
00294                         writer.WriteStdDevs(stdev);
00295                         writer.WritePixels(npixels);
00296                         if (outliers.size() > 0) {
00297                                 writer.WriteOutlierCoords(outliers);
00298                         }
00299                         if (masked.size() > 0) {
00300                                 writer.WriteMaskCoords(masked);
00301                         }
00302                 }
00303 
00304                 if (channelVec.size() > 1) {
00305                         affymetrix_calvin_io::MultiChannelCelFileCollater collator;
00306                         collator.Collate(tmpFileNames, outCelFileName);
00307                         { for( int i=0; i < tmpFileNames.size();  i++ ) { Fs::rm(tmpFileNames[i]);} } ;
00308                 }
00309         }
00310         catch(Except &e) {
00311                 Err::errAbort(e.what());
00312         }
00313         catch(const std::bad_alloc &e) {
00314                 { for( int i=0; i < tmpFileNames.size();  i++ ) { Fs::rm(tmpFileNames[i], false);} } ;
00315                 Err::errAbort("Ran out of memory. "
00316                         "Try quitting other applications.");
00317         }
00318         catch(CalvinException &ce) {
00319                 { for( int i=0; i < tmpFileNames.size();  i++ ) { Fs::rm(tmpFileNames[i], false);} } ;
00320                 Err::errAbort("Affymetrix GeneChip Command Console library has thrown an exception. "
00321                         "Description: '" +StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(ce.Description()) + "'");
00322         }
00323         catch(const std::exception &e) {
00324                 Err::errAbort("Exception caught. "
00325                         "Most problems with this program are memory related. "
00326                         "Message is: " + ToStr(e.what()));
00327         }
00328         catch(const BaseException &e) {
00329                 Err::errAbort("newmat issue: " + ToStr(e.what()));
00330         }
00331         catch(...) {
00332                 Err::errAbort("Unknown exception caught "
00333                         "(most problems with this program are memory related).");
00334         }
00335 }
00336 
00337 /**
00338 * Transform old-style CEL files (text, xda)
00339 */
00340 void CELTransformerEngine::transformOld(int celIx, vector<ChipStream *> &cStreamVec) {
00341         affxcel::CCELFileWriter celWriterOld;
00342         celWriterOld.SetFileName(celFiles[celIx].c_str());
00343         if (!celWriterOld.Read()) 
00344                 Err::errAbort("Can't read cel file: " + celWriterOld.GetFileName());
00345 
00346         string format = "unknown";
00347         if (celWriterOld.IsXDACompatibleFile())
00348                 format = "xda";
00349         else if (celWriterOld.IsTranscriptomeBcelFile())
00350                 format = "bcel";
00351         else if (celWriterOld.IsCompactCelFile())
00352                 format = "ccel";
00353         else if (celWriterOld.IsVersion3CompatibleFile())
00354                 format = "text";
00355 
00356         // the celfile might be mapped read-only -- make it writeable
00357         celWriterOld.EnsureNotMmapped();
00358         int numCells = celWriterOld.GetNumCells();
00359         for (int featIx = 0; featIx < numCells; featIx++) {
00360                 float intensity = (*cStreamVec[cStreamVec.size() - 1]).getTransformedIntensity(featIx, celIx);
00361                 celWriterOld.SetIntensity(featIx, intensity);
00362         }
00363         string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00364         string outCel = Fs::join(outDir , Fs::basename(celWriterOld.GetFileName()));
00365         celWriterOld.SetFileName(outCel.c_str());
00366 
00367         bool success = false;
00368         if (format == "text") 
00369                 success = celWriterOld.WriteTextCel();
00370         else if (format == "xda")
00371                 success = celWriterOld.WriteXDABCel();
00372         else if (format == "bcel")
00373                 success = celWriterOld.WriteTranscriptomeBCel();
00374         else if (format == "ccel") 
00375                 success = celWriterOld.WriteCompactBCel();
00376         else 
00377                 Err::errAbort("Don't recognize type: " + string(format));
00378 
00379         if (!success)
00380                 Err::errAbort("could not save file: " + outCel);
00381         celWriterOld.Close();
00382 }
00383 
00384 /** 
00385 * Transform all of the cel files specified using the chipstream modification stream
00386 * specified by the chipStreamStr and save the new modified cel files in the output directory.
00387 */
00388 void CELTransformerEngine::runImp() {
00389         /* get basic layout info */
00390         colrow_t numCols, numRows;
00391         int probeCount, psCount;
00392         vector<string> chipTypes;
00393 
00394         bool force = getOptBool("force");
00395         string cdfFile = getOpt("cdf-file");
00396     string clfFile = getOpt("clf-file");
00397     string pgfFile = getOpt("pgf-file");
00398     string spfFile = getOpt("spf-file");
00399         string qccFile = getOpt("qc-probesets");
00400         string chipstream = getOpt("chipstream");
00401 
00402         if (!force)
00403                 EngineUtil::checkCelAnalysisType(chipstream,celFiles);
00404 
00405         if (cdfFile != "") {
00406                 EngineUtil::getCdfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, psCount, cdfFile);
00407                 if (!force)
00408                         EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(chipTypes, probeCount, celFiles, numRows, numCols);
00409         }
00410         else if (pgfFile != "") {
00411                 EngineUtil::getPgfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, pgfFile, clfFile);
00412                 if (!force)
00413                         EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(chipTypes, probeCount, celFiles, numRows, numCols);
00414         }
00415         else if (spfFile != "") {
00416                 EngineUtil::getSpfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, psCount, spfFile);
00417                 if (!force)
00418                         EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(chipTypes, probeCount, celFiles, numRows, numCols);
00419         }
00420         else {
00421                 getDimensions(celFiles[0], numCols, numRows);
00422                 probeCount = numCols * numRows;
00423         }
00424 
00425         /* Get the layout for the chip. */
00426         // Specifies probesets, locations of features on chip.
00427         ChipLayout layout; 
00428         // empty list of probesets, ie we want to load all
00429         std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> probeSetsToLoad; 
00430         // empty list, ie load everything
00431         std::vector<bool> probeSubset; 
00432         // we have already check chip type, so use empty string;
00433         string chipType; 
00434         //
00435         probeidmap_t killList;
00436 
00437         if (qccFile != "")
00438         {
00439                 QCProbesetOptions qcc_opts;
00440                 QCProbesetOptions::readQCCFile(qccFile, qcc_opts);
00441                 layout.setQCProbeSets (qcc_opts.headerProbesets);
00442         }
00443 
00444         if (cdfFile != "") {
00445                 Verbose::out(1, "Opening cdf file: " + Fs::basename(cdfFile));
00446                 if (!layout.openCdf(cdfFile, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, probeSubset, chipType, killList, false)) 
00447                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open cdf file: " + cdfFile);
00448         }
00449         else if (pgfFile != "") {
00450                 affx::ClfFile clf;
00451 
00452                 /* open clf file. */
00453                 if (clfFile=="") 
00454                         Err::errAbort("Must specify a clf file for chip.");
00455                 Verbose::out(1, "Opening clf file: " +  Fs::basename(clfFile));
00456                 if (!clf.open(clfFile))
00457                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open clf file: " + clfFile);
00458                 layout.setDimensions(clf.getXMax() + 1, clf.getYMax() + 1);
00459 
00460                 /* Make sure our assumptions about CLF file are true */
00461                 Err::check(clf.getSequential() == 1,
00462                         "ProbesetSummarizeEngine::loadPgfLayout() - unable to handle clf file without sequential set to 1.");
00463                 Err::check(clf.getOrder().compare("col_major") == 0 || clf.getOrder().compare("row_major") == 0,
00464                         "Unable to handle clf file without order set to row_major (old mislabeled 'col_major' accepted due to earlier bug.)");
00465 
00466                 /* open pgf */
00467                 Verbose::out(1, "Opening pgf file: " + Fs::basename(pgfFile));
00468                 if (!layout.openPgf(pgfFile, clf.getXMax() + 1, clf.getYMax() + 1, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, NULL, probeSubset, chipType, killList, false, false))
00469                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open PGF file: " + pgfFile);
00470         }
00471         else if (spfFile != "") {
00472                 std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> psTypesToLoad;
00473                 Verbose::out(1, "Opening spf file: " + Fs::basename(cdfFile));
00474                 layout.openSpf(spfFile, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, probeSubset, chipType, false, psTypesToLoad);
00475         }
00476         else {
00477                 Verbose::out(1,"Setting layout dimensions from cel file. Assuming all probes are PM.");
00478                 layout.setDimensions(numCols, numRows);
00479                 vector<bool> mask(layout.getProbeCount(), true);
00480                 layout.setPmProbeMask(mask);
00481         }
00482 
00483         /* get list of probes to kill */
00484         /* we do this after the chip layout load as we don't want these to drop on the floor */
00485         string killListFile = getOpt("kill-list");
00486         if (killListFile != "")
00487                 ChipLayout::fillInKillList(killListFile, killList, numRows, numCols);
00488 
00489         /* Setup chipstream factory */
00490         ChipStreamFactory cFactory;
00491 
00492         string targetSketch = getOpt("target-sketch");
00493         string probeNormFile = getOpt("probe-norm-file");
00494         string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00495         if (targetSketch != "") 
00496                 cFactory.readTargetSketchFromFile(targetSketch);
00497         if (getOptBool("write-sketch") == true) 
00498                 cFactory.setWriteSketchDir(outDir + Fs::osPathSep());
00499         if (getOptBool("a5-write-sketch") == true) 
00500                 cFactory.setWriteSketchDir_a5(outDir + Fs::osPathSep());
00501         if (probeNormFile != "")
00502                 cFactory.readNormProbesFromFile(probeNormFile);
00503         if (killListFile != "") {
00504                 /// @todo allow provision of kill list to Chipstream Factor
00505                 ///cFactory.setKillList(killList);
00506                 Err::errAbort("Kill list not yet implemented. Try probe-norm-file instead.");
00507         }
00508 
00509         /* Create our chipstream objects. */
00510         std::string chipStreamStr = getOpt("chipstream");
00511         ChipStream *cStream = NULL;      // Our chipstream for transforming data.
00512         vector<ChipStream *> cStreamVec;
00513         vector<string> words;
00514 
00515         Util::chopString(chipStreamStr, ',', words);
00516         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
00517                 string dummy;
00518                 cStream = cFactory.chipStreamForString(words[i], layout, dummy );
00519                 if (!cStreamVec.empty()) {
00520                         cStreamVec[cStreamVec.size() - 1]->registerStream(cStream);
00521                         cStream->registerParent(cStreamVec[cStreamVec.size() - 1]);
00522                 }
00523                 cStreamVec.push_back(cStream);
00524         }
00525 
00526         /* Create intensity mart */
00527         std::vector<int> dummy_order(probeCount);
00528         for (int i = 0; i < probeCount; i++) {
00529                 dummy_order[i] = i;
00530         }
00531 
00532         IntensityMart* iMart = NULL;
00533         bool useDisk = getOptBool("use-disk");
00534         if (useDisk) {
00535                 int cacheSize = getOptInt("disk-cache");
00536                 string tempDir = getOpt("temp-dir");
00537                 DiskIntensityMart* diskMart = new DiskIntensityMart(dummy_order,
00538                         celFiles, 
00539                         cacheSize * 1048576, 
00540                         tempDir, 
00541                         "apt-transform.tmp.", 
00542                         true);
00543                 iMart = diskMart;
00544         }
00545         else {
00546                 SparseMart* sparseMart = new SparseMart(dummy_order,celFiles,true);
00547                 iMart = sparseMart;
00548         }
00549 
00550         /* set cel files */
00551         CelReader cReader;               // Object for getting data from cel files.
00552 
00553         cReader.setFiles(celFiles);
00554 
00555         /* Let reader know to pass data to our chipstream object. */
00556         cReader.registerStream(cStreamVec[0]);
00557         cReader.registerIntensityMart(iMart);
00558         Verbose::out(1,"Reading cel files.");
00559 
00560         /* Open, read, and send cel file data one by one to chipstream. */
00561         cReader.readFiles();
00562 
00563         /* Transform the data and write it out. */
00564         unsigned int dotMod = max((int)celFiles.size()/20, 1);
00565         Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Adjusting and writing files", 20, (int)dotMod, (int)celFiles.size());
00566 
00567         for (int i = 0; i < celFiles.size(); i++) {
00568                 Verbose::progressStep(1);
00569                 if (affymetrix_cel_converter::CELFileVersion::DetermineCELFileVersion(celFiles[i].c_str())==affymetrix_cel_converter::Calvin_Version1)
00570                         transformNew(i,cStreamVec);
00571                 else
00572                         transformOld(i,cStreamVec);
00573         }
00574 
00575         delete cStream;
00576 
00577         Freez(iMart);
00578 
00579         /* Remove the temp dir if it is empty */
00580         string tempDir = getOpt("temp-dir");
00581         if (Fs::isWriteableDir(tempDir))
00582                 Fs::rmdir(tempDir,false);
00583 
00584         Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00585 }
00586 
00587 void CELTransformerEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00588 {
00589         EngineUtil::getCelFiles(celFiles, this);
00590         
00591         /* Sanity checks... */
00592         if (getOpt("chipstream") == "") 
00593                 Err::errAbort("Must specify a chipstream transformer.");
00594         if (getOpt("out-dir") == "") 
00595                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output directory.");
00596         if (getOpt("probe-norm-file") != "" && getOpt("kill-list") != "") 
00597                 Err::errAbort("Cannot provide a kill list and a probe norm list.");
00598         if (celFiles.empty()) 
00599                 Err::errAbort("Must specify at least one cel file to open.");
00600 
00601         /* Make our directory. */
00602         string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00603         Util::chompLastIfSep(outDir);
00604         setOpt("out-dir", outDir);
00605         if (!Fs::isWriteableDir(outDir)) {
00606                 if (Fs::mkdirPath(outDir, false) != APT_OK) {
00607                         APT_ERR_ABORT("Can't make or write to directory: " + outDir);
00608                 }
00609         }
00610 
00611         string tempDir = getOpt("temp-dir");
00612         if (tempDir == "") {
00613                 tempDir = Fs::join(outDir,"temp"); 
00614                 setOpt("temp-dir", tempDir);
00615         }
00616 }
